channels.summary: Shared academic and journalistic analyses on OSINT’s strengths/limits, AI’s impact on survey research, pharmaceutical data transparency, and institutional OSINT programs, plus discussion of death-voyeurism ethics and reports about pressure on academic researchers.

highlights.title: Reuters Institute: Israel–Gaza war and the limits of open‑source reporting
highlights.details: Article from the Reuters Institute examining how the Israel–Hamas war showcases both the power and the limitations of open‑source reporting, useful as a teaching case for OSINT and journalism courses.

highlights.title: 404 Media: AI agent that evades online survey integrity checks
highlights.details: Report on a researcher-built AI agent that answered online surveys while evading detection 99.8% of the time, raising concerns about bot contamination in social science survey datasets.

highlights.title: ProPublica: RX Inspector generic drug quality dataset
highlights.details: ProPublica article on an FDA dataset ("RX Inspector") that streamlines access to information needed to evaluate generic drug quality and supply chains, lowering barriers for academic research on pharmaceuticals.

highlights.title: Utrecht University's Open Source Global Justice Investigations Lab
highlights.details: Lab focused on open-source investigations related to global justice and governance, offering an institutional model and potential collaboration hub for academic OSINT work.

highlights.title: Queen’s University Belfast – GLAN-linked programme
highlights.details: Programme at Queen’s Belfast connected to the Global Legal Action Network (GLAN), relevant for those interested in human rights, law, and open‑source evidence in accountability processes.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Stage Talk audio feed
highlights.details: RSS link for Bellingcat’s Stage Talk series, allowing academics and students to integrate audio case studies on OSINT investigations into teaching and self-study.

highlights.title: DOGE_Bellodi_Lee report on political participation (via Bellodi & Lee PDF)
highlights.details: Shared academic report (DOGE_Bellodi_Lee.pdf) on political behavior/participation, highlighted as relevant cross‑posted research for those studying social science and data-driven methods.

highlights.title: Essays on ‘death voyeurism’ and media ethics
highlights.details: New York Times opinion piece and Guardian article on the impact of moment‑of‑death imagery and photojournalism ethics, raising questions about consumption of graphic content and its societal effects.

highlights.title: Terence Tao comments on reported suspension under UCLA crackdown
highlights.details: Message tracking rumors about Terry Tao’s research being suspended, resolved via Tao’s own Mathstodon post confirming an update, illustrating verification of academic news via primary social accounts.

mentions: Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism
Open Source Global Justice Investigations Lab

channels.summary: Server-wide updates promoted Bellingcat’s challenge platform, multiple Stage Talk recordings, and new investigations (including on US immigration enforcement), while flagging opportunities for community participation.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Open Source Challenge platform
highlights.details: Ongoing series of open‑source puzzles hosted by Bellingcat, used for skill‑building and community collaboration on geolocation and verification tasks.

highlights.title: Stage Talk – Open Source Munitions Portal
highlights.details: Podcast episode of Bellingcat’s Stage Talks discussing the Open Source Munitions Portal, with links and recording provided for those interested in ordnance identification and conflict monitoring.

highlights.title: Stage Talk – Cold case murder investigation (mafia, gamblers and pigeons)
highlights.details: YouTube recording of a Bellingcat researcher explaining how open‑source methods were applied to decades‑old murder cases involving organized crime, used as a long‑form case study in OSINT.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Stage Talk with DoubleThink Lab on Foreign Information Manipulation
highlights.details: Announcement of a Stage Talk featuring Jasper Hewitt from DoubleThink Lab, focused on tracking inauthentic accounts and deep‑dive FIMI (Foreign Information Manipulation and Interference) investigations.

highlights.title: Bellingcat & Evident Media investigation into Illinois ICE raids
highlights.details: Bellingcat article examining ICE raids in Illinois and use of force in light of a recent court order, offering open‑source documentation of immigration enforcement.

channels.summary: Brief geolocation chatter on balloon/airship sites in China and a community challenge comparing islands off Myanmar’s coast.

highlights.title: Myanmar offshore islands geolocation challenge
highlights.details: Prompt inviting users to compare two islands off Myanmar’s coast, linked via a prior Discord message and suitable for practicing coastal and island geolocation workflows.

channels.summary: Channel noted a pause in office hours but remained active with reports on museum thefts, discussion of underreported heritage recoveries, and research strategies for expensive/out‑of‑print art crime literature and DOJ case files.

highlights.title: Theft at Zilvermuseum Doesburg (Netherlands)
highlights.details: ARCA-linked blog post detailing the theft of approximately 300 silver pieces from the Zilvermuseum Doesburg, with context on patterns of theft‑for‑commodification at museums.

highlights.title: BBC News report on recent art crime case
highlights.details: Shared BBC article on a contemporary art crime case, contributing mainstream media coverage to complement specialist art‑crime reporting.

highlights.title: Strategy for accessing out‑of‑print or overpriced art‑crime books
highlights.details: Advice that researchers can sometimes obtain a writer’s draft directly from authors of out‑of‑print works (if contracts allow), offering a cost‑effective way to access niche literature.

highlights.title: Sifting art‑adjacent transactions in DOJ Epstein case files
highlights.details: ARCA researchers are examining art‑related transactions within large volumes of DOJ Epstein documentation, noting the difficulty of connecting scattered files amid predominantly sexual‑exploitation material.

channels.summary: Shared reporting on Cambodian tycoon Chen Zhi’s deportation to China over alleged involvement in human trafficking-linked scams and large‑scale financial crimes.

highlights.title: Deportation of Cambodian tycoon Chen Zhi (Prince Holding Group)
highlights.details: Article describing how Chen Zhi, head of Prince Holding Group, was deported to China amid allegations of profiting from pig‑butchering scams, forced labor, fraud, and money‑laundering estimated around $10 billion.

channels.summary: Referenced social media reports and discussed possible US special forces activity related to airspace closures near Mexico.

highlights.title: Jennifer Jacobs tweet on unusual US airspace activity
highlights.details: Link to a Jennifer Jacobs post (via fxtwitter) used as a source for discussing an apparent airspace closure and its possible connection to US special forces operations near Mexico.

highlights.title: Aaron Rupar (BlueSky) posts on airspace and security incident
highlights.details: BlueSky links from Aaron Rupar were shared to track updates and commentary on the same developing aviation/security story, supplementing traditional news sources.

channels.summary: Members debated accurate terminology for ‘less-lethal’ munitions in protest policing literature and shared links on European and Australian hypersonic weapons testing.

highlights.title: Terminology shift from ‘less‑than‑lethal’ to ‘less‑lethal’ munitions
highlights.details: Discussion drawing on academic literature about protest policing, arguing that ‘less‑lethal’ better reflects that such munitions can still cause death, whereas ‘less‑than‑lethal’ falsely implies they cannot.

highlights.title: European hypersonic missile test (Hypersonica)
highlights.details: Report of a successful European hypersonic missile test from Hypersonica, relevant for tracking advances in high‑speed weapons systems.

highlights.title: Hypersonix & Rocket Lab hypersonic air‑breathing test vehicle
highlights.details: Announcements from Hypersonix AU and Rocket Lab on an upcoming launch of a hypersonic air‑breathing test vehicle, illustrating commercial partnerships in hypersonic R&D.

channels.summary: Shared resources on mapping Central Asian militaries and discussed Russian troop deployments in Armenia and disinformation narratives around ‘biolabs’ in the region.

highlights.title: Oxus Society viz of Tajik military units
highlights.details: Interactive visualization from Oxus Society showing Tajikistan’s military units, useful for researchers mapping force structure and deployment across Central Asia.

highlights.title: Upcoming interactive map of 620+ military facilities in Uzbekistan
highlights.details: Teaser about an in‑development interactive map of over 620 military facilities in Uzbekistan, indicating forthcoming open data for regional military analysis.

highlights.title: DFRLab reporting on ‘biolabs’ disinformation in Armenia
highlights.details: Commentary on a DFRLab report showing how Ukraine-style ‘biolabs’ conspiracy narratives are being adapted to Armenia, implicating CDC and USAID and even scientific conferences, underscoring the spread of health-related disinfo.

highlights.title: EuromaidanPress: Russian troop buildup in Armenia
highlights.details: Article citing Ukrainian intelligence on Moscow accelerating troop deployments to Armenia amid rising tensions with Azerbaijan, relevant for regional security monitoring.

highlights.title: Clarification on peace deal ‘initialed’ vs ‘signed’ (Clash Report context)
highlights.details: Message dissecting a Clash Report post, clarifying that a peace agreement was only ‘initialed’ (agreement on text) rather than formally signed and ratified, highlighting the importance of legal terminology in conflict coverage.

channels.summary: Recognized contributions from new geolocators and documented a completed geolocation of damage in Kozats’ke & Vesele, Kherson, including precise coordinates and source links.

highlights.title: Geolocation ID 2547 – Kozats’ke & Vesele, Kherson (residential damage)
highlights.details: Provided coordinates for multiple photos of residential areas in Kozats’ke and Vesele, Kherson (e.g., 46.797151, 33.354942), with Google Maps and Telegram source links, demonstrating standard geolocation documentation practice.

channels.summary: Minor methodological comment on how repeated typos across multiple accounts sharing a narrative could still be a useful signal of coordination, without additional resources or tools shared.

Focused on Bellingcat’s own outputs: promoting the Toolkit, annual report, WhatsApp channel, and multiple Stage Talk podcast episodes on topics from art crime and immigration raids to far-right fashion and Central Asian militaries.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Toolkit (GitBook)
highlights.details: One‑year‑old curated toolkit of open‑source investigation tools with use cases, guidance, and reviewer feedback, maintained by community volunteers.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Annual Report 2024
highlights.details: Annual overview of Bellingcat’s 2024 investigations, impact, and lessons learned, useful for understanding organisational priorities and methodologies.

highlights.title: Bellingcat WhatsApp updates channel
highlights.details: Official WhatsApp channel for receiving Bellingcat updates directly, aimed at users who avoid other social platforms.

highlights.title: Stage Talk – Tracking a lost Brueghel with Arthur Brand
highlights.details: Podcast episode of ‘Stage Talks with Bellingcat’ featuring art detective Arthur Brand, covering methods used to track down a lost Brueghel painting.

highlights.title: Stage Talk – US immigration raids
highlights.details: Recording of a Stage Talk on US immigration raids, accessible via podcast platforms, illustrating open‑source methods in documenting enforcement operations.

highlights.title: Stage Talk – ‘Sketchy boats’ investigation
highlights.details: Stage Talk episode examining suspicious maritime activity (‘those sketchy boats’), available on podcast platforms via the Bellingcat Stage Talks feed.

highlights.title: Stage Talk – Far-right fashion
highlights.details: Podcast episode discussing far‑right fashion as a lens on extremist movements, now available via the Stage Talks feed.

highlights.title: Stage Talk – Mapping Central Asia’s armed forces
highlights.details: Conversation with Oxus Society’s Michael Hilliard on what ‘military power’ means in practice and how logistics and mapping of Central Asian armed forces shape it.

channels.summary: Reported the discovery of a cross-country Latin American bot network identifiable via a shared Golang formatting error in posts, demonstrating a concrete technical signature for coordinated inauthentic behavior.

highlights.title: LATAM bot network identified via Go formatting error signature
highlights.details: User documented 70+ accounts across at least five Latin American countries all posting strings containing the Golang formatting error pattern "%!(EXTRA string=...)" within tight time windows, amplifying contradictory political content—suggesting a coordinated inauthentic network.

channels.summary: Shared tools for monitoring deforestation and marine environments, climate risk reporting, an update on glyphosate safety research, and an Indigenous land rights case, alongside a note on platform moderation.

highlights.title: Nusantara Atlas – Deforestation visualization
highlights.details: Interactive map for visualizing deforestation in Indonesia, Malaysia, Brunei, Papua New Guinea, and Colombia, useful for environmental OSINT and land‑use change analysis.

highlights.title: Washington Post: US dams are sinking, raising safety risks
highlights.details: Article (with archive link) on US dams subsiding and the associated infrastructure and safety risks, providing context for environmental and climate resilience investigations.

highlights.title: Glyphosate safety paper retracted after 25 years
highlights.details: Mastodon post noting that a seminal paper long used to justify glyphosate’s safety has been retracted due to concerns about authorship and misrepresented contributions, impacting regulatory and scientific debates.

highlights.title: Copernicus Marine Jupyter notebook tutorials
highlights.details: Set of Jupyter notebook-based e‑learning materials from Copernicus on environmental monitoring and analysis, suitable for people doing environmental OSINT or learning to work with marine datasets.

highlights.title: Grist: Miccosukee Tribe and ‘Alligator Alcatraz’ land dispute
highlights.details: Article describing how the Miccosukee Tribe blocked the ‘Alligator Alcatraz’ project and how Trump later blocked a bill to return their land, intersecting Indigenous rights, conservation, and federal politics.

highlights.title: Cafeteria menu swap reduces carbon footprint by 30%
highlights.details: Short video showing that simply swapping dishes in a canteen’s weekly menu cut its carbon footprint by about 30%, illustrating the impact of behavioral nudges in institutional food systems.
